posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Inspirational Defender (Bard 27 / Fighter 6 / Rogue 7)





Original Source: https://www.wallpaperflare.com/static/9 ... lpaper.jpg


This build is designed as a protector and tank for parties, with buffing from the awesome bardic abilities.

Rogue is included in the build for evasion (which synergises well with the + to saves from spellcraft), the ability to disarm/retrieve epic traps (protecting your party) and 4d6 sneak attack, punishing enemies who choose not to face you and target the teammates you are protecting.

There are limits as to how much HP I could give this character due to the poor hit die from both Bard (d6) and Rogue (d6) and clearly a dwarven defender would have far more health, but would lack spellcasting and a very powerful bardic song. I thought 460+ HP was enough and can be buffed further by items or spells.

Craft wand is there so you can spam improved invisibility, bulls strength (erm I'm still learning how to use this feat) on teammates.

Set trap 9 modified is in there to boost disable trap but also to allow one to set deadly traps with items, one with the land scrolls/spells or capping dexterity but hopefully someone else can do that for you.

Any single handed weapon will be good for this build, the best weapons will slashing weapons so you can cast keen weapon on it, but in some environments this is not necessarily that important. I've chosen longsword to give the character a more knightly look but scimitars are probably more optimal with their crit range in a Str build with WS/EWS.

I've dropped the AB a bit and increased Cons for more tankability but I wanted the AB high enough so that it would also be enjoyable as a solo character. I figured a base AB of 38 combined with Bard Song / Curse Song, Bardic buffs (ie Bull's Str) and UMD should be able to do the task. I wasn't prepared to drop the AB further in a build with undispellable improved invisibility to include armor skin however.

I haven't maxed Taunt in this build although one could swap Concentration for Taunt if desired, its maxed in this build to grant taunt resistance.

Anyway thanks for reading this far. This is still a design concept, haven't play tested it yet, and haven't made any primary class bard builds before but this is looking unique and might be quite a nice party member to have, whilst being effective enough as a soloist. Appreciate any comments

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
This is a great asset to any party!
Weapon specialization and trap skills (set and removal) are very handy to help the teammates, both on frontline and support sides.
This Pc will have minor problems with goblins in WoG, as he alone can deactivate all traps and get out of there with more potions!
Also, WS greatly compensates the lack of the RDD STR boost.

I like also the final HP, considering that it mainly bard and rogue based, and the attributes.
If I had done this build by myself, I would maybe had a bard 29 / rogue 5 / fighter 6...with epic will to help the will save.

I know, I am too much focused on saves....

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Aquarius for your comments!
I did think about going Bard 29/Rogue 5/Fighter 6 for the extra bard caster levels/bard song uses/bonus feat but chose the current formation for the spaced out skill dumps for disable trap in epic levels / 8 skill points (heh its almost an epic skill focus) / 1d6 sneak attack,  I think there are pros and cons to both approaches !

Edit: after playtesting the build to 16, have adjusted the skill progression into the main post to take disable trap earlier and the perform skill progression delayed until more bard levels obtained

posts.author: Menhir Rocksolid
posts.content: For the best Bard Song possible (+7 AC, or -7AC when using Curse Song), you want 30 Bard levels. From Rogue you only really need evasion as you're not dex based (no big need for uncanny dodge). I'd hence go 32/6/2 Bard/Fighter/Rogue, taking the Rogue levels during epic levels for skill dumps (16/4 bard/fighter pre-epic).

Hello Menhir! Thanks for posting and welcome to the ECB forum!
I think your idea might be ok if one is playing for maximal lvl 40 power and in your environment you can get the perform skill up to 100 with items to improve bard song +6 AC -> +7 AC or curse song -6 -> -7 AC. 

There are downsides to such an approach and overall I felt it was best not to chase this. 

It is a heavy investment for a small bonus and you might get more out of other magic properties from items. Single player modules where exp is limited there will be exp penalties, and parties in pre-epic levels will suffer from not having your search skill and disable traps skills available. There will also be a lot of skill points lost including the large boost to skill points from taking rogue at level 1. 

Anyway hope this explains my thoughts adequately, and once again welcome!

posts.author: Menhir Rocksolid
posts.content: Getting to +7 is indeed a huge investment and is probably only worth it if you're typically part of a party (multiplier), and if your server/module has the items (+perform). Bard/PM 30/10 (with wounding whispers) is btw also a nice option to make enemies not want to touch you with anything but arrows or spells from a distance.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: I really like the Wounding Whispers idea Menhir! I'll have to try it out

posts.author: Menhir Rocksolid
posts.content: The old PvP build was 30/10 Bard/PM with whispers, using chaos shield, curse song and taunt. Good to have on your team paired up with some RDD dev crit monsters (1/2-orc Fighter Bard RDD (28/2/10) for highest DC). No big need for AC, making other equipment choices much more open. For PvE you might perhaps want to get in Evasion (depending on module/server monsters).
